meanings.definition: Have an idea or impression of the existence, presence, or truth of (something) without certain proof.
meanings.sent1: I suspect the cat is hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The detective suspects foul play in the case.
meanings.sent3: Why do you suspect the cookies disappeared so quickly?
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds made me suspect a storm was coming.
meanings.sent5: She could not help but suspect something was wrong.

meanings.definition: Regard someone or something with suspicion or mistrust.
meanings.sent1: I suspect the new neighbor is not who they claim to be.
meanings.sent2: The security guard suspects everyone entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The dog's suspicious behavior made me suspect he was up to no good.
meanings.sent4: Her constant lying made me suspect her motives.
meanings.sent5: The old house made me suspect it was haunted.

meanings.definition: A person thought to be guilty of a crime or offense.
meanings.sent1: The suspect was taken into custody by the police.
meanings.sent2: The suspect denied any involvement in the robbery.
meanings.sent3: The suspect's alibi was as flimsy as a paper bag.
meanings.sent4: The suspect's eyes darted around nervously during questioning.
meanings.sent5: The suspect's fingerprints were found at the crime scene.
